reviews.title: Total Bummer
text: I took my wife here to experience some humour. I asked them if we could see some stand up comedy. They said to see Chris Locke and Steve Patterson. They made a lot of what I thought was improv. They just seemed to be winging it. Their jokes were all about their discomfort with male on male sexual contact. When I teased them a bit, saying "Say something funny", they teased me back for awhile. I didn't say anything, but then when I went to get a beer, they had me thrown out. It was my wife's birthday.
Total bummer.

reviews.title: Comedy Bar Ha Ha
text: This is our favourite Comedy bar! It's intimate and a fun place to go with a partner or friends. Tickets are reasonably priced and so are drinks. Highly recommend.

reviews.title: Great Comedy Night in Toronto!
text: Saw a show called Vermin Melville Presents: Wide Variety Comedy Show here last month, and I loved every moment! The venue is super close to the subway, the stage has a great presence and sound, and THE SHOW! I laughed so so hard! Some of the performers are also producers and were so friendly to speak to after the show. They said they hold the show monthly there, very worth checking out if you are in the city!

reviews.title: Laughed so much our jaws hurt - awesome show!!
text: Went to the Danforth location  last night to the Back to the Future show and it was awesome! As there is a lot of improv in the show each show would be a bit different.  Although there was audience interaction the days of heckling are long gone thank God!!!  They also serve food and drinks right to your seat.  My only complaint is the space is small and they really pack them in very tightly so if one was to get food it would be difficult eating it in such tight quarters. I see someone else commented that the show space was very hot and luckily last night being early spring the temperature was comfortable but can definitely see how it would get hot in the summer month with so many people packed into that space.  Regardless, we really enjoyed ourselves and the only negative was our jaws hurt from laughing so much!!  Will definitely be back!!

reviews.title: Horrible front door guy!
text: Although the comedy was great, the guy working at the front (on Dec 2/21) was SO rude and unpleasant. Totally uncalled for. Way to ruin a great night! I would go back if I knew he wasn’t working.

reviews.title: Greta show
text: Every comedian was funny and put on a great show. The show itself was great and wouldn't recommend.The show area was so hot it made it very uncomfortable. They need major air flow down there. Was all stuffed up by the end of the show. Fans...AC..something !

reviews.title: Sunday Night Live was an entertaining show
text: I was quite impressed with Comedy Bar. Came for the Sunday Night Live  which is a local rendition of Saturday Night Live. The skits were humourous and easy to follow. The acoustics were excellent as you can hear the actors voices from any spot in the room. Staff were super friendly... from the ticket booth to the bartenders, they were great to interact with.

The seating arrangement is a bit difficult to navigate. We sat behind the bar rails, which was great to rest our drinks on, but people sitting directly in front of you end up blocking some of your view.
For those with mobility limitations, the venue is located on a lower level that is accessible by stairs.
Overall, this is a good place to catch a comedy show with a group of friends.

reviews.title: multiple rooms, lots of shows, clean and fun
text: I have been here a few times and it has been a great time, one of my favourites Nigel Grinstead performs here sometimes so catch him if you can! Staff was very polite and fun. They have 3 rooms for comedy shows if i am not mistaken.

reviews.title: Hilarious
text: It was my first time and I didn’t expect much but we had a great time, one Comedian kinda odd that was uncomfortable and made the audience uncomfortably very silent but overall great.

reviews.title: Fun, Interactive and Funny
text: I've been wanting to go for some time now and finally had the chance to go on Firday. It's hidden and unless you are looking for it you won't find it. We had a great time, laughed, drank good beer and left around 2am. I will definitely go back.

reviews.title: a Great night out
text: My wife and I went to the comedy bar to see the Catch 23 show hosted by Jason Agnew on Friday 17th June and we had a fantastic time. The tickets where reasonably priced at $10 and the show itself was hilarious. It was my first time at an improv event so I wasn't sure what to expect but all the teams and Jason the host nailed it and I was laughing out loud all evening. The bar staff where friendly and the place has a good selection of reasonably priced beer. If you are in Toronto this is a brilliant place to go and have a good laugh. I highly recommend checking out the catch 23 show if you can.

reviews.title: Hilarious with reasonable drink prices!
text: We came here for Beerprov and it was so funny! We laughed so hard, and the show was definitely worth the $20 price. Drinks here are surprisingly reasonably priced - about $6.50 a pint of delicious craft draft, better than the regular price of most bars!

reviews.title: Laughed my face off!
text: My companion and I went to an East Coast comedy show here and it was very funny. We loved it and would go back for sure!

reviews.title: A great, fun place to frequent!
text: I was here two weeks ago to see Jimmy Pardo. He did almost an hour of stand up comedy, then taped a 'Never Not Funny' Podcast. He did this twice over a two night period. The price was $50 each evening, and this was because he is a big name. I see regular nights go as low as $10 for a evening of entertainment!  Contrary to what I have read online, I found the venue to be clean, organized, not too loud. There is a full bar. I didn't look for a menu so I'm sorry I can't comment. The bathroom (women's) is clean. There was no bad smell from the kitchen as I have read online. Check online for their schedule...there are lots of big comedians, and tons of beginners.
I will definitely return....especially to see Jimmy Pardo!

reviews.title: Small place, Big laughs!
text: Went to the Comedy Bar last Saturday for my birthday. I was a little leery about
the Huey Lewis Greatest Hits show because it was Karaoke audience participation.I
decided to shrink into a corner and go unnoticed. Of course they picked me to give them a theme!
The cast took a two word theme and created an hour long totally improvised production interwoven with Huey Lewis songs and lighting effects. The level of

instantaneous imagination that went into it was truly impressive. Combine this with the reasonable cover,casual atmosphere and friendly staff and you have a recipe for a good time. Thanks Comedy Bar, I plan to return soon!

reviews.title: Urban improv house doesn't disappoint!
text: One of my favourite spots in the neighbourhood, Comedy Bar always delivers the laughs. Admission is quite reasonable. The beer is cold and about the same price as elsewhere. The food is good for a place that doesn't specialize in food. My favourite Friday night activity is Catch23 at Comedy Bar with friends.

reviews.title: You get what you pay for
text: Found a great deal on the internet and decided to check this place out. 10 of us went to to see "Sunday Night Live" by the Sketchers (their take on Saturday Night Live). 10$ to get in- the ticket girl had attitude, they delayed the show (inconsiderate for those of us working Monday morning), only 1 bartender for the entire bar who couldn't care less if you waited 30min to get a drink or 5min.. But the worst part was the jokes were terrible. It seemed the entire audience were friends of the comedians, many being fake laughing loudly. Honestly the jokes were poor, I've seen far better at Yuk Yuk's & Second City. Don't waste your time & money here.

reviews.title: OK
text: The show was OK, the red-headed bartender, on the contrary, wasn't. Honestly she was so rude in not looking anyone in the eye and focusing on her phone more than her customers. This made us never want to visit the place again.... Such arrogance.

reviews.title: Great acts and good audience
text: I have been to the Comedy Bar twice and Yuk Yuk's once. In my opinion the quality of comedian that the Comedy Bar attracts is much much better. It's also a more intimate seating area and makes it feel more important and better quality. The location is great, right across from Ossington subway station on Bloor. It's located in a very good and trendy neighbor hood. Lots of places to eat and drink at before or after the show. If you want comedy in Toronto come to this place.

reviews.title: Low life show
text: me and my fiancee we decided to Do something on a Saturday evening specially when it's rainy day
I looked up comedy nights in Toronto
I saw the comedy bar with very good ratings
Honestly that was the lowest of the low
Comedian very trashy
Attacking white people , straight couples
So sad that they have all these ratings
Shame on you

reviews.title: Great wntertainment
text: The Catch 23 gig is awesome.  The improv concept is wild and must be faced by brave and competent actors.  Lots of laughs for almost 2h.  Great place to go with friends.

reviews.title: Get a seat at the front so you can hear the comedians
text: For only a $5 cover this is a fabulous deal to see new upcoming talent. The downside is that you must get into the small venue first to get a decent seat.
Our seats were at the back of the very small and narrow room. Right next to the door to the bar area and holy mackerel you can not hear a thing other than the bar.
One of the comedians that watched a portion of the show from the back turned up the mic when he went up to perform but to be honest that was not any better.
It is not worth visiting there if you are sitting in the last 3 rows. If you can push your way up to the front then it is well worth the $5!

reviews.title: Very Reasonable Price for a Live Show
text: We were in Toronto on a Tuesday night and decided to check out the Comedy Bar. The show was hosted by Solomon and Smith and featured 3 other comedians. The quality of the acts varied, but at $10, the 1.5 show was worth it. The room had about 75 seats and it was 3/4 full on Tuesday night.  There was a bar in the lobby and there wasn't a minimum for drinks.

reviews.title: Great Entertainment, Great Price!
text: We all had a great time a few weeks ago when we went to the Comedy Bar - $15 for three acts, that's unheard of! All were pretty good too:))

Tip: It's a small venue so it gets super overheated by the end of the show, a bit distracting unfortunately for several of us; bring a small hand fan to make the end of the performances as pleasant os the first ones.

reviews.title: A must-do for real comedy fans
text: If you're into comedy and want to bump into someone you've seen on TV, or want to see someone on stage now who you'll be seeing on Conan or Kimmel in a few months, this is the place to go in Toronto. Big names often show up here after their headlining shows elsewhere in the city and every now and then a surprisingly well known comedian will do a small intimate show here for an insanely low price. I saw Scott Thompson do stand-up here once for $5, before he did a show in NYC. That sums it up right there.

I'd say just follow them on social media to keep up to date on what shows are happening each night as there is always something new going on. Either that or just drop in and see what's on stage that day.

Try not to compare Comedy Bar to Second City or Yuk Yuks. The formula and vision for all 3 are quite different. It's probably safe to say that anyone you see at Second City or Yuk Yuks participated, wrote, produced or starred in a show you missed at Comedy Bar.

reviews.title: Great time with friends
text: We went here Friday night and we had so much fun! They were really funny and they involved the audience quite a bit, which was fun especially considering everyone had seemed to hit up the bar before.
Speaking of which the bar was fairly priced, especially for downtown, but I thought the food was a little expensive.
Overall I would go back and I would recommend this venue to everyone! It would be a great date night activity, especially a first date, and also fun for large groups/friends.
Very casual.

reviews.title: Hilarious, LOL fun....
text: Enjoyed a rollicking good time compliments of Jason and a trio of improv. groups competing to win the title of the night's funniest...Very reasonable $ 10 tickets and well priced food and drinks made for a great evening. After the 2 hour 8 pm show, there was an opportunity to partake in the later show at reduced prices. Glad we found this place, but not suitable for children or a sensitive soul...
